meaningMnemonic: People think <radical>tsunami</radical>s are only made of water but they have a <radical>few</radical> pieces of <kanji>sand</kanji> in there too. There's actually more sand in the ocean than most people think. And tsunamis can't just have water and sharks in them. A few grains of sand will always slip in.
readingMnemonic: How do I know there's <kanji>sand</kanji> in there? Because I <reading>saw</reading> (さ) them!
